item.title: In judo, before you learn the cool moves, you first have to learn how to fall. Maybe we should be training researchers the same way: first learn how things can go wrong, and only when you get that lesson down do you learn the fancy stuff.

item.title: This empirical paper has been cited 1616 times but I donâ€™t find it convincing. Thereâ€™s no single fatal flaw, but the evidence does not seem so clear. How to think about this sort of thing? What to do? First, accept that evidence might not all go in one direction. Second, make lots of graphs. Also, an amusing story about how this paper is getting cited nowadays.
